metadata.title: USN-6693-1 -- .NET vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that .NET did not properly handle certain specially crafted requests. An attacker could potentially use this issue to cause a resource leak, leading to a denial of service.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6693-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  netstandard-targeting-pack-2.1-7.0 - 7.0.117-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 dotnet-hostfxr-7.0 - 7.0.117-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 dotnet-apphost-pack-7.0 - 7.0.117-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 aspnetcore-targeting-pack-7.0 - 7.0.117-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 dotnet-templates-7.0 - 7.0.117-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 dotnet-targeting-pack-7.0 - 7.0.117-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 dotnet7 - 7.0.117-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 dotnet-sdk-7.0-source-built-artifacts - 7.0.117-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 aspnetcore-runtime-7.0 - 7.0.117-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 dotnet-sdk-7.0 - 7.0.117-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 dotnet-runtime-7.0 - 7.0.117-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 dotnet-host-7.0 - 7.0.117-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 No subscription required  dotnet-sdk-8.0 - 8.0.103-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 netstandard-targeting-pack-2.1-8.0 - 8.0.103-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 dotnet-templates-8.0 - 8.0.103-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 dotnet-sdk-8.0-source-built-artifacts - 8.0.103-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 No subscription required  dotnet8 - 8.0.103-8.0.3-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 No subscription required  aspnetcore-runtime-8.0 - 8.0.3-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 dotnet-apphost-pack-8.0 - 8.0.3-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 dotnet-targeting-pack-8.0 - 8.0.3-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 aspnetcore-targeting-pack-8.0 - 8.0.3-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 dotnet-runtime-8.0 - 8.0.3-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 dotnet-hostfxr-8.0 - 8.0.3-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 dotnet-host-8.0 - 8.0.3-0ubuntu1~22.04.1 No subscription required
